channel.title: Computers on Tiernan's Comms Closet
channel.description: Recent content in Computers on Tiernan's Comms Closet

item.title: Daily Carry
Dell C6100
item.description: Dell C6100 servers I bought a Dell C6100 a while back. 4 nodes, each with Dual Xeon E5506 processors, 36Gb RAM. They share 12 drives bays (3 dedicated to each machine) and each machine has 2 GigE ports and an IPMI port. These machines are running Windows Server 2016, and have a mix of drives, mostly spare. I think 3 have a 250Gb Drive, one boots from a 750Gb disk, and 2 have 64Gb SSDs for extra space, one has a 500Gb for extra space.

item.title: Dell Poweredge 1600SC
item.description: [decommissioned…] P4 Xeon processor 1.75Gb RAM 80GB HDD Windows Server 2003 Enterprise AD and DNS, but currently a backup… may be decommissioned soon

item.title: GodBox v2
item.description: GodBox V2 Dell Precision T7600 Workstation: Dual 8 Core Xeons (E5-4620 @ 2.2Gz each) 160Gb RAM (DDR3) 3x 2Tbs with 2x256Gb Samsung 850 Pro SSDs and a third unknown 256GB (SSDs in RAID 0, the 3 drives are in 2 Windows Storage Spaces pools) Drobo 5D with 5X4Tb drives and a 256Gb SSD for performance (about 20Tb RAW, ~16Tb usable) NVidia Geforce GTX 970 graphics card 2 Dell 2007WFP Monitors and 2 [Dell P2815Q]https://amzn.

item.title: Godbox
item.description: GodBox V1 The GodBox is my main Hyper-V server and backup workstation. Its specs are as follows: Dual Intel Xeon E5520 processors at 2.26Gz each. They are Quad core and are Hyper Threaded… Windows sees 16 processors! 84Gb RAM (DDR3 ECC) 2 300GB Western Digital VelociRaptors in RAID 0 for boot. 4 hard drives in a storage pool. 2X1TB Western Digital Green Drives, 2Tb Seagate Barrcuda Green drive, 500GB Samsung Spinpoint drive.

item.title: HP Storageworks P4300 (i think) G2
item.description: HP StorageWorks P4300 G2 servers I bought 2 HP StorageWorks P4300 G2 servers a while back. They each have Dual Xeon E5520 Quad core processors, 12Gb RAM, 8 1TB SAS Disks (i think they are 7200RPM) and each include 2 GigE net ports and an IPMI management port. Planning on doing something with these soon…

item.title: Mac Mini
item.description: Late 2012 Mac Mini Specs: 2.3 Gz Intel i7 (Quad core) 12GB RAM 1.25Tb Fusion Drive (256Gb SSD and a 1Tb HDD) OSX El Capitan Drobo Mini with 4 2TB HDDs Currently acts as a Plex Media Server for the house.

item.title: Mac Pro
item.description: Mac Pro, Late 2006 model 1.1 2 Quad Core Xeons (Upgraded from stock Dual Dual Cores). 30Gb RAM (Actually 32, but one stick keeps failing) 74Gb Western Digital Raptor for boot 1TB HDD for data storage ATI Radeon X1900XT Graphics card OSX El Capitan

item.title: MacBookPro
item.description: Late 2008 MacBook Pro, 15” Specs: 2.4Gz Processor 8GB RAM 64Gb SSD OSX Yosemite

item.title: Microsoft Surface Book
item.description: 2015 Microsoft Surface Book Specs: Intel Core i7 6600U @ 2.6Gz 16GB RAM 512Gb NVMe Samsung SSD Windows 10 Insider Surface Dock plugged into home network This is a work laptop, and man, it is very nice! find my self using this at home a lot too…

item.title: ProLiant ML110
item.description: HP Proliant ML110G5 This machine has a Core2Quad Q6600, 8Gb RAM and some storage… It also has 12 Gigabit network ports: 2 Quad port Intel Gigabit NICs (PCI Express) 1 Dual Port Intel Gigabit NIC (PCI-X in a PCI slot) 1 Single Port Intel Gigabit NIC (PCI Express) 1 Single onboard NIC (don’t know who make it) This machine was doing lots of testing for the Double speed Internet series but is currently sitting idle…

item.title: Router
item.description: Router The main Internet Router in the lab is VM running VyOS Internet wise, I have moded to business class brodband from Virgin Media: Virgin Media Unlimited 400mb/s Cable modem with 40Mb/s upload speed. The modem is in bridge mode. as part of the business package, a /29 static IP range is included.

item.title: TV Server
item.description: 3 core AMD (don’t even know which one) 2 4 port DVB-S2 TV tuners this is currently off, but planning on rebuilding it and getting it back live… eventually…
